snippet: “Picasso Black and White,” at the Guggenheim, billed as the first monochromatic look at his career, is a refreshing change from the parade of shows about Picasso’s relationships with women or other artists.
abstract: Karen Rosenberg reviews exhibit Picasso Black and White at the Guggenheim Museum.
lead_paragraph: “Picasso Black and White,” at the Guggenheim, billed as the first monochromatic look at his career, is a refreshing change from the parade of shows about Picasso’s relationships with women or other artists.

headline.seo: ‘Picasso Black and White’ at the Guggenheim Museum
headline.main: Colorless Panorama Widens Vistas of Picasso
headline.print_headline: Colorless Panorama Widens Vistas of Picasso
